Package RateLimiter

Class Throttle

java.lang.Object
RateLimiter.Throttle
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
TestThrottle
public abstract class Throttle
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
This class is used for call back to inform the application if the user has exceeded the limit or not.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected long limit
    Maximum number of requests allowed in a time frame.
    protected long requests
    Number of requests served to the user in the current time frame.
    private boolean statusCode
    Used to determine if a request is within limit.
    protected long timeStamp
    The time at which the user requested the api.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Throttle()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    abstract void Exceeded()
    This method will be called when the request has exceeded the limit.
    abstract void notExceeded()
    This method will be called when the request is within limit.
    void run()
    The appropriate action for each requests will taken using a seperate thread, so that it wont block other requests.
    void status​(boolean statusCode, long currentTime, long requests, long limit)
    This method will set the necessary fields related to the request.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • statusCode

      private boolean statusCode
      Used to determine if a request is within limit. true if requests are within limit and false otherwise.

    • timeStamp

      protected long timeStamp
      The time at which the user requested the api.

    • requests

      protected long requests
      Number of requests served to the user in the current time frame.

    • limit

      protected long limit
      Maximum number of requests allowed in a time frame.

  • Constructor Details

    • Throttle

      public Throttle()

  • Method Details

    • notExceeded

      public abstract void notExceeded()
      This method will be called when the request is within limit. It is declared as abstract, so that necessary actions will be defined during implementation.

    • Exceeded

      public abstract void Exceeded()
      This method will be called when the request has exceeded the limit. It is declared as abstract, so that necessary actions will be defined during implementation.

    • status

      public void status​(boolean statusCode, long currentTime, long requests, long limit)
      This method will set the necessary fields related to the request.
      Parameters:
      statusCode - Used to determine if a request is within limit.
      currentTime - The time of request.
      requests - Number of requests served in current time frame.
      limit - Maximum number of requests allowed.

    • run

      public void run()
      The appropriate action for each requests will taken using a seperate thread, so that it wont block other requests.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
